q.quote: Change is the end result of all true learning.
q.author: Leo Buscaglia

q.quote: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.
q.author: W. C. Fields

q.quote: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
q.author: Leo Buscaglia

q.quote: Gardens are not made by singing 'Oh, how beautiful,' and sitting in the shade.
q.author: Rudyard Kipling

q.quote: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It's the best part of the day.
q.author: George Allen, Sr.

q.quote: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.
q.author: Edgar Allan Poe

q.quote: The mother's heart is the child's schoolroom.
q.author: Henry Ward Beecher

q.quote: Gardens are not made by singing 'Oh, how beautiful,' and sitting in the shade.
q.author: Rudyard Kipling

q.quote: Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.
q.author: Carol Burnett

q.quote: If you don't love me, it does not matter, anyway I can love for both of us.
q.author: Rudyard Kipling

q.quote: There are only three things women need in life: food, water, and compliments.
q.author: Chris Rock

q.quote: Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.
q.author: Chris Rock

q.quote: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.
q.author: Rudyard Kipling

q.quote: There are only three things women need in life: food, water, and compliments.
q.author: Chris Rock

q.quote: You must not fight too often with one enemy, or you will teach him all your art of war.
q.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
